reviews.title: best things come in small packages

reviews.text: breakfast was very nice,the rooms were fairly small but clean and comfftable bathrooms are onsuite also small but always lovely and clean the hotel is on park ave in manhatten it is very near to macys and times square .its about 25 mins walk to bloomingdales and centrel park.if you want to get to ground zero you will need to get a yellow cab this is about $10.i would recommened this hotel to my friends
reviews.title: Location location location
Good facilities but management is a bit offputting
reviews.text: This hotel was outstanding. You cannot beat the price or the location. One block north of the the subway. I booked 3 rooms for my Girl Scout Troop & each room was clean and spacious (we had the rooms with the 2 double beds). The halls are small & the elevator is small but the stairs are easily accessable. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.
I have stayed at the Embassy Suites and the beds here were much more comfy!
reviews.title: Great location, small but clean room

reviews.text: The staff was outstanding and extremely helpful.
reviews.title: I've seen better hotels

likes.liked: — Flat screen TV in the room

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Clarion Hotel Park Avenue on Friday and Saturday of Thanksgiving Weekend. It was by far the best deal around at $161/night for a room with one double bed. Most other hotels were charging double that price. We typically like to stay in Murray Hill, Gramercy, Kip's Bay, because it's convenient to Penn Station, the 6 subway train, and easy access to the Village and Midtown. The Clarion, while pretty much average in every way did the job despite it being one of the smallest hotel rooms we've ever had outside of traveling in Europe. However, the room was fairly clean and updated and they managed to pack a lot of amenities into such a tiny space. The best feature was the large flat-screen tv in the room. We could pull it out and lay on the bed and it was almost at our feet. The bathroom was updated though it had one of the smallest tubs that I had ever seen. We didn't have any view, except of a fire escape between two buildings that was covered in pigeon dirt. However, we enjoyed the short stay there and the staff was courteous. I would likely not stay there again if I had the choice of larger rooms elsewhere, but like I said, for the price on a holiday weekend, you couldn't beat it.
reviews.title: Smallest Hotel Room Outside of Europe

likes.liked: — Low price on a holiday weekend
likes.disliked: — Tiny room, a bit pricey for the size of the room, and not the newest place

reviews.title: Hated the Clarion Park Avenue
reviews.text: Was booked here on a business trip. Worst hotel I have stayed in years. Tiny rooms and bathroom. No internet service when I was there. Room reeked of a putrid disinfectant smell.

I don't know if the hotel has a pervasive bed bug problem or if it was an isolated incident, but I stayed in Room 408 (a single twin room) and there were bed bugs. I spoke with the manager on duty who didn't seem to be too surprised or overly concerned. I don't know if they did anything about it, so I would be aware of it if you stay here.
reviews.title: Bed bugs Room 408

reviews.text: Otherwise, everything people have said about this hotel is true. Small dark rooms with small bathroom, great location with subway less than two blocks away, Starbucks across the street, slow elevators, staff is not rude but not overly concerned with your comfort, good air conditioning. If it wasn't for the bed bugs, I would have probably given this hotel an average rating because I was expecting all of those things I mentioned above - except for the bugs.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Clarion on Park Avenue South is a small, older hotel that you can get for cheap (paid $189/night). When I stayed there, they were replacing the furniture in all the rooms, which meant that the already very small lobby was filled to the ceiling with nightstands and headboards, making it impossible to sit in the lobby and enjoy their free wifi.
reviews.title: Great one night Stay

reviews.text: I had the opportunity to visit during the July 4th weekend this year, and my travel partner and I stayed at the Clarion Park Av S for the two nights we were in town.
reviews.title: Decent place to stay at.

likes.liked: — Front desk staff and concierge were very helpful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Plusses:

reviews.text: - COMFY bed. Very nice pillows. Summertime included a duvet cover if you like to have one over you with the air conditioning on.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: New York City has to be the most difficult place I've encountered to find a good quality reasonably priced hotel aside from London. Everything on Manhattan seems to be expensive, so you will have to shell out a bit.
reviews.title: Affordable and Central, but far from perfect

likes.disliked: — Heating, Small Rooms, View from windows

reviews.text: In the end we booked the Clarion because a friend was staying there, because lets face it - it doesn't have the best Trip Advisor ranking!
reviews.title: Nice place for New York

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is small, in Manhattan terms, sandwiched between two larger buildings, it is almost misplaced on Park Avenue. Its almost slightly homely as you walk in, a small reception area and one small lift which serves the 8 (or so) floors. It is extremely central, close to the empire state building, with a metro on the same block, and 15 minutes walk from Times Square.
reviews.title: Good value, good location

likes.liked: — Location, large room by New York City standards, private bathroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are similar, very small - although probably to be expected whilst staying in such a heavily populated and expensive area. They've just about managed to squeeze a double bed in, and a small desk and chair which occupies space contested with the door, you'll need to squeeze by if the someone is using the desk. The desk also hosts the coffee making equipment and a lamp, you can barely fit a laptop on there - but its worth the squeeze, as you get free WiFi in this hotel. The bathroom is equally small, with a small (half) sized bath with shower attachment. The best thing about the rooms, is the fantastic 40" Sony LCD television (you'll get a slightly smaller one in the single rooms), which is a great after a long day walking about the city.
reviews.title: Ok for NYC

reviews.text: There are a few things which annoyed us. Firstly the heating, which seemed to be turned up full whack on our first few days - it was almost unbearable. We had to have the air conditioning occasionally, which is ridiculous in winter! The air conditioning is essentially useless, its loud and ineffective - so in summer (and winter it seems!) you'll be baking at night unless you dont mind the loud fans whirling. The other thing, was the view from the window. Possibly the worst I've ever encountered, you get a view of the dirty brickwork of the building next door, about 4 feet away - so you get hardly any sunlight through there. You'll also notice a fire exit stairway decorated with bird poop, and if you're lucky - a couple of pigeons sitting on your window going "coo, coo, coo"! Fantastic! You wont want to open your window here.
reviews.title: Depends what you paid
